text_image_relationship.layout_style: Grid of six narrative miniatures in two columns and three rows, each set within a Gothic arcade of three pointed arches. Horizontal caption bands in red and black separate each register. A continuous geometric border frames the entire page, visually unifying text and image.

text_content.script_style: Gothic textura quadrata; professional book hand with regular, angular letterforms, extensive use of abbreviations and ligatures, red rubrics for captions

color_scheme.color_usage: Gold leaf reserved for holy figures and backgrounds; ultramarine and azurite blues highlight donors’ robes and Marian imagery; minium red used in rubrication and donor garments; layered white highlights create volume in drapery; alternating red and blue checkerboard throne patterns establish visual rhythm; pigments remain vibrant with minimal oxidation.

features: Regular grid of six equal panels
Hierarchical scaling: enthroned figures larger than donors

decorative_elements: Interlaced red, blue and gold geometric border
Gothic micro-architecture with pointed arches and colonnettes
Red rubric captions integrating text and image
Fine foliate punchwork in gold grounds

drawing_technique.line_style: Precise brown ink outlines with uniform weight, fine internal detailing in drapery and facial features
drawing_technique.shading_method: Minimal pen hatching; tonal modeling achieved via layered pigment washes and white highlights
drawing_technique.perspective_handling: Hierarchical scaling; shallow depth indicated by overlapping figures and ground lines; no true linear perspective

reading_order: Top left → Top right → Middle left → Middle right → Bottom left → Bottom right

scene_relationships.subject: Two male figures conversing (donor and cleric) beneath a three-bay arcade
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Leads to the confession scene as the donor seeks saintly counsel
visual_connections: Donor’s blue robe matches next scene’s kneeling figure
Gothic arch framing continues across panels

scene_relationships.subject: Kneeling donor before a seated haloed saint holding a book; attendant stands in doorway
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Flows into the enthronement scene where the saint receives veneration
visual_connections: Checkerboard throne pattern echoes in next panel
Red floor tiles continue beneath both donors
Halo and gold leaf background unify divine presence

scene_relationships.subject: Kneeling donor before an enthroned saint on a tall checkerboard dais
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Progresses to a scene of solitary contemplation and temptation
visual_connections: Donor’s posture mirrors next kneeling figure
Blue and red robes repeat the established palette

scene_relationships.subject: Kneeling donor in prayer before a standing saint, with a tree and donkey behind
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Precedes Marian devotion, indicating the donor’s turn to the Virgin
visual_connections: Tree motif reappears in border framing next scene
Gold ground continues behind sacred figures
Donor’s gesture of prayer anticipates Marian intercession

scene_relationships.subject: Kneeling donor reading from a book before an enthroned Virgin and Child
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Leads to the deathbed scene, representing final consolatory grace
visual_connections: Reader’s book anticipates texts held by angels next
Blue and red of robes mirrored in angelic garments
Arch design and checkerboard dais remain consistent

scene_relationships.subject: Deathbed scene: angels attend the donor’s soul as clerics stand by
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Final scene concludes the hagiographic sequence; no further panel
visual_connections: Angelic wings echo donor’s earlier gestures
Clustered figures mirror groupings in upper right scene
Continuous border pattern unites the entire series

visual_continuity: Burnished gold leaf backgrounds across all six scenes
Gothic pointed arch framing unifies panels
Checkerboard throne platforms in four scenes
Donor kneeling posture in five panels
Consistent palette of blue, red and gold

content_theme.scene_description: The page comprises six narrative panels in a strict grid, each framed by three Gothic arches. In every scene a kneeling donor in a blue tunic and red cloak seeks intercession: first with a cleric, then before a seated saint, an enthroned pontiff, a standing holy figure beside a tree and donkey, the Virgin and Child, and finally in a deathbed setting surrounded by angels and clerics. Architectural features repeat: slender colonnettes, pointed arches, and checkerboard dais motifs. Donor gestures of prayer and gaze connect him to each holy recipient. The Virgin and Child panel shows the donor clutching a prayer book, while in the final scene angels bear a small soul figure upward. Scale relationships are hierarchical: enthroned figures tower over the donor. Drapery is articulated with layered pigments and white highlights. Red rubrics above and below each register provide captions. A geometric interlaced border in red, blue, and gold encloses the composition. The consistent visual vocabulary—gold grounds, checkerboard patterns, azure robes—establishes unity across the hagiographic life cycle, from counsel to confession, devotion, and the donor’s passing.

religious: two attending angels in final scene
secular: kneeling donor in blue tunic and red cloak (repeated five times)
attendant at doorway in upper right

technical_features.material: Premium calf vellum, uniformly smooth and creamy, with faint hair-follicle patterns; ruled in plummet to guide text and frames; six folios forming a quaternion gathering.
technical_features.preservation_condition: Excellent overall; pigments vibrant, gold leaf lustrous; minor flaking of red miniatures at edges; slight cockling at lower corners; evidence of  twentieth-century consolidation in margins.
notable_physical_characteristics: Raised gesso preparation under gold leaf, creating subtle relief
Fine underdrawing in brown ink visible under UV
Punchwork decoration in gold grounds forming small rosettes
Regular ruling grooves for text and image frames
Layered pigment application with visible brush strokes in drapery folds

secondary_functions: Display of patron’s piety and status
functional_analysis.intended_audience: Individual noble patron engaging in personal prayer and meditation

analysis.scholarly_interpretation: This six-scene grid exemplifies a high-Gothic Parisian hagiographic illumination, likely produced c. 1320 in a secular workshop servicing aristocratic clients. The use of burnished gold leaf, fine azurite blue, and minium red, combined with pointed-arch framing and checkerboard dais motifs, reflects the mature decorative vocabulary of the period. The repeated portrayal of the kneeling donor before successive holy figures—cleric, saint, pontiff, Marian image, and angels—demonstrates a program of personal intercession culminating in a deathbed vision, reinforcing themes of penance and divine mercy. The consistent visual continuity—gold grounds, palette, architectural framing—binds six episodes into a unified devotional narrative. Paleographically, the Gothic textura quadrata script with red rubrics suggests a luxury commission. Technically, raised gesso and intricate punchwork under gold indicate sophisticated material treatment. Iconographically, the progression from clerical counsel to Marian devotion and angelic reception mirrors contemporary devotional texts emphasizing the Virgin’s mediatory role. Compared to other Parisian manuscripts such as the Psalter of Blanche of Castile, this cycle emphasizes donor integration into the sacred narrative. The balanced grid format and crisp architectural framing reflect workshop practices favoring clarity and repetition, while the emotive gestures and individualized facial types hint at collaboration between master illuminator and assistants. Overall, the page marries traditional iconography with refined compositional unity, serving both as an expression of elite piety and a testament to the technical achievements of early 14th-century illumination.
